member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Paradox.UI.StretchDirection
member.summary: Describes how scaling applies to content and restricts scaling to named axis types.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.UI.StretchDirection.Both
member.summary: The content stretches to fit the parent according to the Stretch mode.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.UI.StretchDirection.DownOnly
member.summary: The content scales downward only when it is larger than the parent. If the content is smaller, no scaling upward is performed.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.UI.StretchDirection.UpOnly
member.summary: The content scales upward only when it is smaller than the parent. If the content is larger, no scaling downward is performed.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Paradox.UI.StretchType
member.summary: Describes how content is resized to fill its allocated space.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.UI.StretchType.None
member.summary: The content preserves its original size.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.UI.StretchType.Uniform
member.summary: The content is resized to fit in the destination dimensions while it preserves its native aspect ratio.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.UI.StretchType.UniformToFill
member.summary: The content is resized to fill the destination dimensions while it preserves its native aspect ratio. If the aspect ratio of the destination rectangle differs from the source, the source content is clipped to fit in the destination dimensions.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.UI.StretchType.FillOnStretch
member.summary: The content is resized to fill the destination when stretched by its parent. It keeps its ratio otherwise.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Paradox.UI.StretchType.Fill
member.summary: The content is always resized to fill the destination dimensions. The aspect ratio is not preserved.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Paradox.UI.UIImage.Borders
member.summary: Gets or sets size of the unstretchable borders of source image.
member.remarks: The sizes of source image borders are in UV coordinates (between 0 and 1). Borders size are ordered as follows X->Left, Y->Right, Z ->Top, W -> Bottom. That is the vector (0.1,0.2,0.3,0.4) means that the left border goes from 0% to 10% of the image, the Right border goes from 80% to 100% of the image, the Top border goes from 0% to 30% of the image and the Bottom border goes from 60% to 100% of the image.
